text: Portal cards aren't reserve list. Loyal Retainers was recently reprinted as well as being a FTV card. Imperial Seal was reprinted as a Judge Promo recently. Three Visits, Capture of Jingzhou, Sylvan Tutor, Ravages of War, Temporal Manipulation , Norwood Priestess and Burning of Xinye are most of the EDH-noteworthy cards from the Portal sets that have yet to be reprinted.

Of these cards, there are cards that are effectively the same, or very similar, reprinted elsewhere. Ravages of War is literally Armageddon. Three Visits is literally Nature's Lore. Capture of Jingzhou and Temporal Manipulation are both literally Time Warp. Sylvan Tutor is strictly worse Worldly Tutor. Imperial Seal is strictly worse Vampiric Tutor. Norwood Priestess is close to Elvish Piper.
Would be nice to see a few of the legends reprinted, like Dong Zhou, he's pricey and I've seen him head burn lists, and Yuan Shao is nice in Iroas or soldier tribal
The issue is that in EDH, redundancy is hard to achieve, so it sucks that all these duplicates-with-different-names are so expensive.
Meng Huo is a better Kaysa if you don't care about elves. Not that anyone cares about Kaysa :slightly_smiling_face:

All that said, Nature's Lore = Three Visits > Farseek/Rampant Growth if you're running shocks/ABURs. Only reason to prefer Farseek over Nature's Lore/Three Visits, aside from price (obviously), is because you really want a basic land OR if you want like, a Tundra or an Underground Sea instead of a Gx land.
Yeah, mono-green Three Visits is kind of big since it's a better Rampant Growth and Farseek isn't playable.
Honestly in mono-green I'm probably running all the mana dorks. Boreal Druid/Arbor Elf/Elvish Mystic/Llanowar Elves/Fyndhorn Elves.
so losing out on Three Visits isn't a huge deal.
Titania is the only one where it's like, "eh, oh well."
Can't run mana dorks in my green deck

Yisan/Selvala just want that turn 2 commander pass, so elves+Wild Growth+Utopia Sprawl are the big winners and I guess you can play Nature's Lore but I wouldn't want a ton of those effects. Mono-G elfball.... obviously play elves, haha. Creatures in general synergize with great green cards like Survival and Fauna Shaman
what mono-G deck do you not run mana dorks?

Dorks are kinda overrated anyway, short of Birds or ones that do other things. I guess it's meta dependant, too, but I see too many board wipes to waste slots on cards that are dead draws 90% of the game
Reki
having 3 mana on turn 2 is not a dead draw.
:confused:
The entire game isn't three turns
Elves on turn five sucks
They're alright. You can also just discard them to Fauna Shaman, Scroll Rack them away, etc.
The idea is to use the early mana acceleration to play bigger things faster than other people, if they get wiped later oh well, hopefully you got an advantage from them.

It's a meta thing to a degree. Most decks I see are running 5-7 board wipes w recursion, Pestilence and Pyrohemia, Night of Soul's Betrayal, etc. Dorks are a wasted card slot most of the time unless they're doing other stuff
I wouldn't even play a creature based deck in boardwipe tribal meta.
Regardless though I'm not running non-legends in Reki anyway so they don't help there

Then I'm like Jimmy in Game Knights. "This is my dragon tribal deck. I'm gonna open Llanowar Elves, then Sakura Tribe Elder, then play an Acidic Slime, then a Clone, then the game is over. Isn't dragon tribal cool?"

That said, there's a ton of reaons to run dorks. Having a Clamp or Pod you plan to use a lot or some other sacc outlet, tribal synergy, seeing a lot of stax, etc. I just think people get way too tunnel visioned on dorks being good and think slamming every Llanowar Elf variant into a deck is always great.

I've seen the same thing a ton with mana rocks. Rocks are great, but way to often people just blindly jam 10 in because someone told them that's what you always need without looking to see if their deck can actually use that many. 10 mana is great on turn 5 if you can cast 10 mana worth of stuff, but I've seen a lot of decks that blow their load on rocks and sit there with nothing to do with it.
I dunno. I think ramp is really really good. I'll jam 10 rocks and 10 dorks in my decks.
(not both simultaneously)
I think electricty is really really good. It's less good if I'm in a pool.
Way too many people don't pay attention to the pool part and just fixate on electricty being good.
I think we agree that every good deck has the potential to use all of its mana on every turn. But that doesn't mean cut your 10 rocks or 10 dorks, it means add more draw and more mana sinks, I think.
Tailor it to your deck and meta
And playstyle
That is a great point, Warren

I'm probably a bad person to talk to about not jamming mana acceleration, seeing as my three favorite decks are: Captain Sisay, Mayael, and Thrasios+Tymna, so all three decks basically use every ounce of mana given to them.

But I think that's also why they work well (OK, Mayael is a bit janky). More mana = keep sinking the mana into Thrasios, or tutor bigger things with Sisay. Without mana sink commanders I'd play more draw. Captain Sisay is especially interesting, it's one of those decks where Mox Diamond is unarguably awesome, since getting Sisay out a turn earlier means that you tutor with him a turn earlier --> the card disadvantage of Mox Diamond is mitigated.
That's the point though is that you're not just jamming acceleration. It's really important in those decks and you'll use all of it

the biggest downside I had to dorks in my Thrasios+Tymna list yesterday was that I had Ethersworn Canonist out and like 2 dorks in my hand and I couldn't play them because I had one spell per turn :confused:
Also, paying attention to your curve, and your expected mana output.
without Ethersworn I would have slapped down every dork. Wouldn't have mattered much since I eventually lost to an Elesh Norn, but hey sometimes things happen :stuck_out_tongue:

I had a writing teacher once say that terrible writers ignore the conventions of the written language, good writers follow the conventions of the written language, and great writers ignore the conventions of the written language.

You can probably apply that logic to a lot of things in life. In deck buliding you kind of can. Terrible builders ignore the smart rules of deck contstruction, good builders follow them, and great builders get to ignore them
this is magic the gathering not a uylesses book club, lol.

I think even for like, Ulysses, it ignores an important point that Joyce and the other crazy modernists sort of honored literary tradition. Analogous to deckbuilding, the best decks honor tradition but deviate only in a couple weird ways. And cheating mana is never bad.

I'm not sure what the deck building equivalent of Cormac McCarthy would be. I mostly just think it's a terrible idea to build a deck with "I always run X of X" without actually looking at it and thinking it through.
Maybe you should always run X of X, but you (the royal you) should have at least looked at it and thought about why in that particular build beyond just doing so because that's how you do it.

On the subject of mana dorks--thoughts on using them in a Meren deck? I've seen many recommend them online but I haven't been impressed when I try them in my own build. I can see the reasoning though--its mana ramp that can also become experience counters. Thoughts?
If you want to talk deck construction I heard this great podcast that goes over this in the first episode, called Commander Time! Maybe you should listen to it....
Tribe elder is straight busted in that deck

I guess it depends on the Meren deck, but most I've seen are pretty staxxy so there they probably aren't ever dead since not only are they experience but they're something you can clamp, pod, or just sacc to procc Pact then recast
While not a dork, he is ramp, and is just amazing
Steve feels made for Meren
By himself will get up to five xp, which then means I can start recurring sidisi triggers
And I don't even run infinite combos and at that point I tend to win
The key to Meren is you can just fuck around so long doing stuff that people fall asleep then you can take their wallets.
Free tutor every turn? Don't mind if I do
Meren absolutely 100% wants every single mana dork. No questions asked.
They key to Meren is keeping Meren off the board. Too many times I see folks leave Meren to her own devices for turn after turn and I just shake my head.
Yeah, once that rock starts rolling downhill it's kinda over
Warren, disagree, but my meren is weird
Then it's probably not a deck I'd ever play to be honest :stuck_out_tongue:

Reasons why Meren wants mana dorks: (1) faster Meren. (2) It's a creature deck. Creature synergy. (3) Mana acceleration is great. (4) Skullclamp. (5) Sac outlets in general. (6) If you want to go down that route, stax stuff, so creatures break parity.
(7) Experience counters with those sac outlets.
And Dana, I agree with your trap statement about [[deadbridge chant]] it does ok in meren but it is basically a self mill for ten

attachments.fallback: Deadbridge Chant {4}{B}{G} // Enchantment // When Deadbridge Chant enters the battlefield, put the top ten cards of your library into your graveyard. // At the beginning of your upkeep, choose a card at random in your graveyard. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your hand.
attachments.text:
Enchantment
When Deadbridge Chant enters the battlefield, put the top ten cards of your library into your graveyard.
At the beginning of your upkeep, choose a card at random in your graveyard. If it's a creature card, put it onto the battlefield. Otherwise, put it into your hand.
attachments.title: Deadbridge Chant {4}{B}{G}

text: Not to mention being able to recast Meren a billion times
Chant is awful.
My meren is a relentless rats deck, soooooooiooo meren isn't 100% needed
It's definitely a trap card
If it triggered end step it would at least be playable
oh, that's very different I guess.
Chant is a fun card - you go play all your 'good' cards and let others have their fun.
Not every card has to be good folks.
Like I said, I wouldn't really play it... :stuck_out_tongue: but I can see why you're not on the dork train.
It is fun! I am never excited to play it
never not excited? :open_mouth:
When your deck is running aether vial, dorks aren't all that needed
Unless Vial goes bye-bye...
By then I have 3 mana! I am pretty good to go then Henry!
Nah, I think 1 card out of 100 doesn't mean mana accelerants aren't needed.
I need a [[life of the loam]] so bad

attachments.fallback: No cards found for “life of the loam”. Check your spelling.

text: From the loam?
Tribal decks are why I keep Declaration in Stone handy...
From the loam
[[Life from the loam]]

If you do, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. Otherwise, draw a card.)

text: "Check your spelling"---jeez, Scryfall throwing shade and I haven't even had breakfast yet
Chant is a touch less terrible in Glissa since it puts artifacts in the yard to recur, but yeah, end of turn would make it so much better while still being fair. Waiting a turn is an eternity.
Still, I can't resist the siren's song and despite removing it a dozen times from my deck I know I'll get suckered back in
Top of the turn would be fine, if it also did it once when it ETB
I'm on board with that. Make it so, Dean.
Holy balls, Life is up to 18 bucks?
I'll get right on that.
I was thinking still under ten
Yup
Modern is your friend.
6500 decks on REC too
That puts it in the top 50 green cards
Modern though. There's almost no price bump from when the bog frog got released, the big spike is start of modern season
It is indeed...
Finishing up the latest CMC today. Have I mentioned that I love this podcast?
Thanks. When we're naked and doing blow the whole time it makes it easier for the listener to feel the energy
How do you know my life?
Being that hopped up and nude I'm sure you feel something...

We're kind of having the discussion now about what our next step is. It's fun to do at this point, and we're not really worried about listenership, but if we want to expand you have to actually self promote, etc. and we're not sure A. how to do that, and B. if it will make the whole thing not enjoyable anymore
So do we just keep on keepin' on and treating it like something fun to do where we don't care if we ever have more than 500 listens a week, or do we try to push.
Speaking of podcast, grats to Commander Time for the WotC shout-out
For anyone who didn't see: <http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/daily-magic-update/update-2017-06-05>

We've discussed previously that it's hard to get that info in an accurate way. It's still the thing that springs to mind as an error though
